title: Combining code and data repos

labels.name: question
labels.description: Issue asks a question rather than reporting a problem

labels.name: answered
labels.description: An answer to a question-type issue was provided

body:
#### What is the problem?
Hello. Everyone ... I am beginning to explore datalad and many concepts are new to me and had a simple question. Let's say I have super dataset and would like to have to combine two sub-datasets, one for code and one for data. The handbook suggests `datalad clone --dataset . \` to clone a data dataset (I guess). Would I do the same for a repo that only consists of code? Should I use the regular git commands instead? (I'll crosspost this question in GitHub). Thanks!

#### What steps will reproduce the problem?
`datalad clone --dataset . \`

#### What version of DataLad are you using (run `datalad --version`)? On what operating system (consider running `datalad wtf`)?

0.14.6, Windows 10

#### Is there anything else that would be useful to know in this context?
No

#### Have you had any success using DataLad before?
Just starting. Early beginner 👶🏻
